summary.p: This manuscript is an incomplete version of a Tamil-Portuguese dictionary. At first impression it is based on Antão De Proença's (1624-1666) dictionary even though not all the entries from Antão are reported. The comparison between the two manuscript has not been systematic.
From f2r up to f11r both Tamil entries and Portuguese meaning are found. From f11v onwards, only the Tamil entries have been copied.
Description based on the online digitized version.

layoutDesc.layout: The page has upper, bottom, right, and left margins drawn with pencil. Apart from the two columns, where the first one contains the Tamil headword, the second one the Portuguese meaning, the layout of the page is further organised in rows in grey pencil.

handNote.desc: As stated in the colophon (U1b) on the guard leaf, the scribe for the Tamil portion was Rattinam who copied it in 1848, whereas the Portuguese portion of the Dictionary was copied by Ariel Edouard Ariel in 1849. Double looped ṟa. The puḷḷi is sporadically used in intermediate and final position. An horizontal stroke is used as diacritic for differentiating ra from medial ā.

There are two different stamps. The first one is a red circle containing an eagle and inscribed BIBLIOTHEQUE IMPERIALE MSS (U1b, lf1r, U1c, lf102v). This is the stamp in use from 1852 to 1870 (cf. stamp n. 36 in Josserand and Bruno 1960: 282). The second one is a red oval inscribed Don n° (U1b, lf1r).

origin.origDate: 1848 and 1849. Internal date. See colophon (U1b, f[1]r). Dated to 1760 by Vinson and Feer (1866-, f. 53r, no. 210224 . 223) on unstated grounds.

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Édouard-Simon Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868: 177-224).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

ab.seg:
Copié, le tamil par Rattinam, (1848) le
portugais par moi (1849) sur une manuscrit
appartenant à la famille Tiruvan̂gadam, cet
original est petit in 4° (papier écolier) et se compose
de 290 pages dont la 1re contient de même que
la 3e et la 4e, le commencement de l'ouvrage; il est
comme la copie l'indique, non termné.
La garde de la reliure porte un nr 3, avec
la signature Vazaradarayer.
Collationé par mi (1849).
EAthat is, the initials of Édouard Ariel
septembre 1849.
